newsPost.newsTitle: View My Chain Delivers Massive Branch Savings
newsPost.newsBlurb: View My Chain key tool for independent agents in tough market conditions
newsPost.newsBody:
__View My Chain key tool for independent agents in tough market conditions__

View My Chain, the data-driven property chain management tool, has released figures showing an example of the financial benefits it has delivered to agents over the last 12 months.

They show how View My Chain is best-placed to help local independent estate agents in current tough market conditions of reduced stock, commission pressure and increased competition.

__Key results for Taylor Hill & Bond who run six offices in South Hampshire have shown View My Chain has delivered faster completions and increased commissions:-__

•	Completion – 28 days quicker
 •	Increased stock turnover resulting in £1,807 additional revenue for Q1 2018
 •	Cash flow benefit – £30,400 commission delivered 28 days quicker
•	Commission saved following a chain break – (27 properties in 2017)
 •	2017 cash benefit of £129,109.50 based on 1% commission – £32.2k per quarter

For clients using View My Chain, they have reported changing market conditions, but overall are positive about their outlook for 2018:

Martin Taylor, Managing Director of Taylor Hill & Bond’s states that “the market has been steady for the year so far with new homes more active.  May has been a strong month but we expect early summer to be slow (over the holiday period) with  the second part of Q3 and early Q4 to be strong and not dissimilar to 2017.”

__What are the benefits of using View My Chain? And How does using View My Chain support your efforts?__  He replied “We have championed View My Chain and understood from the outset the benefits of transparency.  Chain breaks are a powerful tool and we have benefited from improvements and efficiencies to our organisation.  We have always been process-driven, so using View My Chain makes sense, it makes things clearer.  Being able to effectively record conversations, date stamps on notes, it’s being diligent.” 

__Another View My Chain customer, Mitul, Managing Director and owner of multiple Whitegates franchise offices across Leicester said:__
“Some believe the property market is booming and some it is in decline. This mixed messaging centres around the now very boring subject of Brexit and with no agreed or structured exit, this is causing uncertainty in the economy as a whole and, for some, decisions around moving are placed on hold.”
“There are pockets in many areas where property is booming. Good schools, thriving communities with a range of amenities helps these areas’ house prices to steadily grow and keep demand strong, so much so that they seem largely unaffected by the macroeconomic effects. An example of this is the Charnwood area of Leicestershire where we have seen an average of 6% annual increase in prices due to strong demand.”
“According to Land Registry figures, property owners have benefited from an average annual price rise of 3.9%, which makes the average property in the UK valued at £226,906.
With the shortage of housing in the UK, demand for property remains strong and despite attempts by developers to build more, supply is not matching demand and we all know what this generally means. With interest rates being low, I believe regardless of talks of a potential small rate increase or uncertainty of Brexit. The British people will continue to pursue their dreams of home ownership and property investment as this is part of our culture. Transactions are taking longer which sometimes distort some numbers but overall for the year, it should still be a strong year for property with steady rises in certain parts of the UK.”

Mitul’s whitegates have recently centralised sales progression, a growing trend in the sector as agents are looking to be more efficient businesses and they have adopted View My Chain as the tool of choice or their centralised sales progression team.

__Mark Vosper, Managing Partner of  Michael Anthony estate agents in Aylesbury said:__
“In the current climate we are finding there are plenty of instructions coming to market, the key is dealing with the vendors who are serious about selling and that are realistic in their expectations of the current market. By working with motivated vendors who listen to our advice, we are achieving a good level of agreed sales and concentrating on the clients that are actually focussed on moving.”

__How will View My Chain help you in 2018?__ 
“We are very happy with the service that View My Chain provides, this product is now embedded across the business.  We use it to at market appraisals to help us win new instructions.  Our staff like using the tool as it’s simple to use and better than other sales progressions systems they have seen. We back the concept and very much feel that View My Chain care about the success of this branch which is a really big positive.”

Sohail Rashid, Founder and CEO of View My Chain comments “Market conditions for the residential property sector this year have been tough and this will not only test the business models of many estate agents but also many proptech estate agency suppliers.  We are focussed on working with agents to help them not only survive but grow and become stronger operationally during this period.  We are delighted that the growing feedback from our customer base is that our sales progression tool is a superior product to anything else in the market and that it is so effective that agents are able to use it to win new instructions over slower adopters in their local markets.”
